noun.description: A variety of asbestos with fine silky fibres which can be woven.

origin: Early 17th century: from Latin amiantus, from Greek amiantos undefiled (i.e. purified of stains by fire, it being incombustible), from a- not + miainein defile. The spelling was changed from the Latin on the pattern of plant names ending in -anthus, from Greek anthos flower.
